005package edu.wpi.first.math.estimator;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.Nat;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.Num;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.Pair;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.StateSpaceUtil;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N1;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.system.Discretization;
014import edu.wpi.first.math.system.NumericalIntegration;
015import edu.wpi.first.math.system.NumericalJacobian;
016import java.util.function.BiFunction;
017import org.ejml.dense.row.decomposition.qr.QRDecompositionHouseholder_DDRM;
018import org.ejml.simple.SimpleMatrix;
019
020/**
021 * A Kalman filter combines predictions from a model and measurements to give an estimate of the
022 * true system state. This is useful because many states cannot be measured directly as a result of
023 * sensor noise, or because the state is "hidden".
024 *
025 * <p>Kalman filters use a K gain matrix to determine whether to trust the model or measurements
026 * more. Kalman filter theory uses statistics to compute an optimal K gain which minimizes the sum
027 * of squares error in the state estimate. This K gain is used to correct the state estimate by some
028 * amount of the difference between the actual measurements and the measurements predicted by the
029 * model.
030 *
031 * <p>An unscented Kalman filter uses nonlinear state and measurement models. It propagates the
032 * error covariance using sigma points chosen to approximate the true probability distribution.
033 *
034 * <p>For more on the underlying math, read
035 * https://file.tavsys.net/control/controls-engineering-in-frc.pdf chapter 9 "Stochastic control
036 * theory".
037 *
038 * <p>This class implements a square-root-form unscented Kalman filter (SR-UKF). For more
039 * information about the SR-UKF, see https://www.researchgate.net/publication/3908304.
040 */
041public class UnscentedKalmanFilter<States extends Num, Inputs extends Num, Outputs extends Num>
042    implements KalmanTypeFilter<States, Inputs, Outputs> {
043  private final Nat<States> m_states;
044  private final Nat<Outputs> m_outputs;
045
046  private final BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<Inputs, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> m_f;
047  private final BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<Inputs, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>> m_h;
048
049  private BiFunction<Matrix<States, ?>, Matrix<?, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> m_meanFuncX;
050  private BiFunction<Matrix<Outputs, ?>, Matrix<?, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>> m_meanFuncY;
051  private BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> m_residualFuncX;
052  private BiFunction<Matrix<Outputs, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>> m_residualFuncY;
053  private BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> m_addFuncX;
054
055  private Matrix<States, N1> m_xHat;
056  private Matrix<States, States> m_S;
057  private final Matrix<States, States> m_contQ;
058  private final Matrix<Outputs, Outputs> m_contR;
059  private Matrix<States, ?> m_sigmasF;
060  private double m_dtSeconds;
061
062  private final MerweScaledSigmaPoints<States> m_pts;
063
064  /**
065   * Constructs an Unscented Kalman Filter.
066   *
067   * @param states A Nat representing the number of states.
068   * @param outputs A Nat representing the number of outputs.
069   * @param f A vector-valued function of x and u that returns the derivative of the state vector.
070   * @param h A vector-valued function of x and u that returns the measurement vector.
071   * @param stateStdDevs Standard deviations of model states.
072   * @param measurementStdDevs Standard deviations of measurements.
073   * @param nominalDtSeconds Nominal discretization timestep.
074   */
075  public UnscentedKalmanFilter(
076      Nat<States> states,
077      Nat<Outputs> outputs,
078      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<Inputs, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> f,
079      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<Inputs, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>> h,
080      Matrix<States, N1> stateStdDevs,
081      Matrix<Outputs, N1> measurementStdDevs,
082      double nominalDtSeconds) {
083    this(
084        states,
085        outputs,
086        f,
087        h,
088        stateStdDevs,
089        measurementStdDevs,
090        (sigmas, Wm) -> sigmas.times(Matrix.changeBoundsUnchecked(Wm)),
091        (sigmas, Wm) -> sigmas.times(Matrix.changeBoundsUnchecked(Wm)),
092        Matrix::minus,
093        Matrix::minus,
094        Matrix::plus,
095        nominalDtSeconds);
096  }
097
098  /**
099   * Constructs an unscented Kalman filter with custom mean, residual, and addition functions. Using
100   * custom functions for arithmetic can be useful if you have angles in the state or measurements,
101   * because they allow you to correctly account for the modular nature of angle arithmetic.
102   *
103   * @param states A Nat representing the number of states.
104   * @param outputs A Nat representing the number of outputs.
105   * @param f A vector-valued function of x and u that returns the derivative of the state vector.
106   * @param h A vector-valued function of x and u that returns the measurement vector.
107   * @param stateStdDevs Standard deviations of model states.
108   * @param measurementStdDevs Standard deviations of measurements.
109   * @param meanFuncX A function that computes the mean of 2 * States + 1 state vectors using a
110   *     given set of weights.
111   * @param meanFuncY A function that computes the mean of 2 * States + 1 measurement vectors using
112   *     a given set of weights.
113   * @param residualFuncX A function that computes the residual of two state vectors (i.e. it
114   *     subtracts them.)
115   * @param residualFuncY A function that computes the residual of two measurement vectors (i.e. it
116   *     subtracts them.)
117   * @param addFuncX A function that adds two state vectors.
118   * @param nominalDtSeconds Nominal discretization timestep.
119   */
120  public UnscentedKalmanFilter(
121      Nat<States> states,
122      Nat<Outputs> outputs,
123      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<Inputs, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> f,
124      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<Inputs, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>> h,
125      Matrix<States, N1> stateStdDevs,
126      Matrix<Outputs, N1> measurementStdDevs,
127      BiFunction<Matrix<States, ?>, Matrix<?, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> meanFuncX,
128      BiFunction<Matrix<Outputs, ?>, Matrix<?, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>> meanFuncY,
129      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> residualFuncX,
130      BiFunction<Matrix<Outputs, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>> residualFuncY,
131      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> addFuncX,
132      double nominalDtSeconds) {
133    this.m_states = states;
134    this.m_outputs = outputs;
135
136    m_f = f;
137    m_h = h;
138
139    m_meanFuncX = meanFuncX;
140    m_meanFuncY = meanFuncY;
141    m_residualFuncX = residualFuncX;
142    m_residualFuncY = residualFuncY;
143    m_addFuncX = addFuncX;
144
145    m_dtSeconds = nominalDtSeconds;
146
147    m_contQ = StateSpaceUtil.makeCovarianceMatrix(states, stateStdDevs);
148    m_contR = StateSpaceUtil.makeCovarianceMatrix(outputs, measurementStdDevs);
149
150    m_pts = new MerweScaledSigmaPoints<>(states);
151
152    reset();
153  }
154
155  static <S extends Num, C extends Num>
156      Pair<Matrix<C, N1>, Matrix<C, C>> squareRootUnscentedTransform(
157          Nat<S> s,
158          Nat<C> dim,
159          Matrix<C, ?> sigmas,
160          Matrix<?, N1> Wm,
161          Matrix<?, N1> Wc,
162          BiFunction<Matrix<C, ?>, Matrix<?, N1>, Matrix<C, N1>> meanFunc,
163          BiFunction<Matrix<C, N1>, Matrix<C, N1>, Matrix<C, N1>> residualFunc,
164          Matrix<C, C> squareRootR) {
165    if (sigmas.getNumRows() != dim.getNum() || sigmas.getNumCols() != 2 * s.getNum() + 1) {
166      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
167          "Sigmas must be covDim by 2 * states + 1! Got "
168              + sigmas.getNumRows()
169              + " by "
170              + sigmas.getNumCols());
171    }
172
173    if (Wm.getNumRows() != 2 * s.getNum() + 1 || Wm.getNumCols() != 1) {
174      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
175          "Wm must be 2 * states + 1 by 1! Got " + Wm.getNumRows() + " by " + Wm.getNumCols());
176    }
177
178    if (Wc.getNumRows() != 2 * s.getNum() + 1 || Wc.getNumCols() != 1) {
179      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
180          "Wc must be 2 * states + 1 by 1! Got " + Wc.getNumRows() + " by " + Wc.getNumCols());
181    }
182
183    // New mean is usually just the sum of the sigmas * weight:
184    //       n
185    // dot = Σ W[k] Xᵢ[k]
186    //      k=1
187    Matrix<C, N1> x = meanFunc.apply(sigmas, Wm);
188
189    Matrix<C, ?> Sbar = new Matrix<>(new SimpleMatrix(dim.getNum(), 2 * s.getNum() + dim.getNum()));
190    for (int i = 0; i < 2 * s.getNum(); i++) {
191      Sbar.setColumn(
192          i,
193          residualFunc.apply(sigmas.extractColumnVector(1 + i), x).times(Math.sqrt(Wc.get(1, 0))));
194    }
195    Sbar.assignBlock(0, 2 * s.getNum(), squareRootR);
196
197    QRDecompositionHouseholder_DDRM qr = new QRDecompositionHouseholder_DDRM();
198    var qrStorage = Sbar.transpose().getStorage();
199
200    if (!qr.decompose(qrStorage.getDDRM())) {
201      throw new RuntimeException("QR decomposition failed! Input matrix:\n" + qrStorage.toString());
202    }
203
204    Matrix<C, C> newS = new Matrix<>(new SimpleMatrix(qr.getR(null, true)));
205    newS.rankUpdate(residualFunc.apply(sigmas.extractColumnVector(0), x), Wc.get(0, 0), false);
206
207    return new Pair<>(x, newS);
208  }
209
210  /**
211   * Returns the square-root error covariance matrix S.
212   *
213   * @return the square-root error covariance matrix S.
214   */
215  public Matrix<States, States> getS() {
216    return m_S;
217  }
218
219  /**
220   * Returns an element of the square-root error covariance matrix S.
221   *
222   * @param row Row of S.
223   * @param col Column of S.
224   * @return the value of the square-root error covariance matrix S at (i, j).
225   */
226  public double getS(int row, int col) {
227    return m_S.get(row, col);
228  }
229
230  /**
231   * Sets the entire square-root error covariance matrix S.
232   *
233   * @param newS The new value of S to use.
234   */
235  public void setS(Matrix<States, States> newS) {
236    m_S = newS;
237  }
238
239  /**
240   * Returns the reconstructed error covariance matrix P.
241   *
242   * @return the error covariance matrix P.
243   */
244  @Override
245  public Matrix<States, States> getP() {
246    return m_S.transpose().times(m_S);
247  }
248
249  /**
250   * Returns an element of the error covariance matrix P.
251   *
252   * @param row Row of P.
253   * @param col Column of P.
254   * @return the value of the error covariance matrix P at (i, j).
255   * @throws UnsupportedOperationException indexing into the reconstructed P matrix is not supported
256   */
257  @Override
258  public double getP(int row, int col) {
259    throw new UnsupportedOperationException(
260        "indexing into the reconstructed P matrix is not supported");
261  }
262
263  /**
264   * Sets the entire error covariance matrix P.
265   *
266   * @param newP The new value of P to use.
267   */
268  @Override
269  public void setP(Matrix<States, States> newP) {
270    m_S = newP.lltDecompose(false);
271  }
272
273  /**
274   * Returns the state estimate x-hat.
275   *
276   * @return the state estimate x-hat.
277   */
278  @Override
279  public Matrix<States, N1> getXhat() {
280    return m_xHat;
281  }
282
283  /**
284   * Returns an element of the state estimate x-hat.
285   *
286   * @param row Row of x-hat.
287   * @return the value of the state estimate x-hat at i.
288   */
289  @Override
290  public double getXhat(int row) {
291    return m_xHat.get(row, 0);
292  }
293
294  /**
295   * Set initial state estimate x-hat.
296   *
297   * @param xHat The state estimate x-hat.
298   */
299  @Override
300  public void setXhat(Matrix<States, N1> xHat) {
301    m_xHat = xHat;
302  }
303
304  /**
305   * Set an element of the initial state estimate x-hat.
306   *
307   * @param row Row of x-hat.
308   * @param value Value for element of x-hat.
309   */
310  @Override
311  public void setXhat(int row, double value) {
312    m_xHat.set(row, 0, value);
313  }
314
315  /** Resets the observer. */
316  @Override
317  public void reset() {
318    m_xHat = new Matrix<>(m_states, Nat.N1());
319    m_S = new Matrix<>(m_states, m_states);
320    m_sigmasF = new Matrix<>(new SimpleMatrix(m_states.getNum(), 2 * m_states.getNum() + 1));
321  }
322
323  /**
324   * Project the model into the future with a new control input u.
325   *
326   * @param u New control input from controller.
327   * @param dtSeconds Timestep for prediction.
328   */
329  @Override
330  public void predict(Matrix<Inputs, N1> u, double dtSeconds) {
331    // Discretize Q before projecting mean and covariance forward
332    Matrix<States, States> contA =
333        NumericalJacobian.numericalJacobianX(m_states, m_states, m_f, m_xHat, u);
334    var discQ = Discretization.discretizeAQTaylor(contA, m_contQ, dtSeconds).getSecond();
335    var squareRootDiscQ = discQ.lltDecompose(true);
336
337    var sigmas = m_pts.squareRootSigmaPoints(m_xHat, m_S);
338
339    for (int i = 0; i < m_pts.getNumSigmas(); ++i) {
340      Matrix<States, N1> x = sigmas.extractColumnVector(i);
341
342      m_sigmasF.setColumn(i, NumericalIntegration.rk4(m_f, x, u, dtSeconds));
343    }
344
345    var ret =
346        squareRootUnscentedTransform(
347            m_states,
348            m_states,
349            m_sigmasF,
350            m_pts.getWm(),
351            m_pts.getWc(),
352            m_meanFuncX,
353            m_residualFuncX,
354            squareRootDiscQ);
355
356    m_xHat = ret.getFirst();
357    m_S = ret.getSecond();
358    m_dtSeconds = dtSeconds;
359  }
360
361  /**
362   * Correct the state estimate x-hat using the measurements in y.
363   *
364   * @param u Same control input used in the predict step.
365   * @param y Measurement vector.
366   */
367  @Override
368  public void correct(Matrix<Inputs, N1> u, Matrix<Outputs, N1> y) {
369    correct(
370        m_outputs, u, y, m_h, m_contR, m_meanFuncY, m_residualFuncY, m_residualFuncX, m_addFuncX);
371  }
372
373  /**
374   * Correct the state estimate x-hat using the measurements in y.
375   *
376   * <p>This is useful for when the measurements available during a timestep's Correct() call vary.
377   * The h(x, u) passed to the constructor is used if one is not provided (the two-argument version
378   * of this function).
379   *
380   * @param <R> Number of measurements in y.
381   * @param rows Number of rows in y.
382   * @param u Same control input used in the predict step.
383   * @param y Measurement vector.
384   * @param h A vector-valued function of x and u that returns the measurement vector.
385   * @param R Measurement noise covariance matrix (continuous-time).
386   */
387  public <R extends Num> void correct(
388      Nat<R> rows,
389      Matrix<Inputs, N1> u,
390      Matrix<R, N1> y,
391      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<Inputs, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>> h,
392      Matrix<R, R> R) {
393    BiFunction<Matrix<R, ?>, Matrix<?, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>> meanFuncY =
394        (sigmas, Wm) -> sigmas.times(Matrix.changeBoundsUnchecked(Wm));
395    BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> residualFuncX =
396        Matrix::minus;
397    BiFunction<Matrix<R, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>> residualFuncY = Matrix::minus;
398    BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> addFuncX = Matrix::plus;
399    correct(rows, u, y, h, R, meanFuncY, residualFuncY, residualFuncX, addFuncX);
400  }
401
402  /**
403   * Correct the state estimate x-hat using the measurements in y.
404   *
405   * <p>This is useful for when the measurements available during a timestep's Correct() call vary.
406   * The h(x, u) passed to the constructor is used if one is not provided (the two-argument version
407   * of this function).
408   *
409   * @param <R> Number of measurements in y.
410   * @param rows Number of rows in y.
411   * @param u Same control input used in the predict step.
412   * @param y Measurement vector.
413   * @param h A vector-valued function of x and u that returns the measurement vector.
414   * @param R Measurement noise covariance matrix (continuous-time).
415   * @param meanFuncY A function that computes the mean of 2 * States + 1 measurement vectors using
416   *     a given set of weights.
417   * @param residualFuncY A function that computes the residual of two measurement vectors (i.e. it
418   *     subtracts them.)
419   * @param residualFuncX A function that computes the residual of two state vectors (i.e. it
420   *     subtracts them.)
421   * @param addFuncX A function that adds two state vectors.
422   */
423  public <R extends Num> void correct(
424      Nat<R> rows,
425      Matrix<Inputs, N1> u,
426      Matrix<R, N1> y,
427      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<Inputs, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>> h,
428      Matrix<R, R> R,
429      BiFunction<Matrix<R, ?>, Matrix<?, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>> meanFuncY,
430      BiFunction<Matrix<R, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>> residualFuncY,
431      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> residualFuncX,
432      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> addFuncX) {
433    final var discR = Discretization.discretizeR(R, m_dtSeconds);
434    final var squareRootDiscR = discR.lltDecompose(true);
435
436    // Transform sigma points into measurement space
437    Matrix<R, ?> sigmasH = new Matrix<>(new SimpleMatrix(rows.getNum(), 2 * m_states.getNum() + 1));
438    var sigmas = m_pts.squareRootSigmaPoints(m_xHat, m_S);
439    for (int i = 0; i < m_pts.getNumSigmas(); i++) {
440      Matrix<R, N1> hRet = h.apply(sigmas.extractColumnVector(i), u);
441      sigmasH.setColumn(i, hRet);
442    }
443
444    // Mean and covariance of prediction passed through unscented transform
445    var transRet =
446        squareRootUnscentedTransform(
447            m_states,
448            rows,
449            sigmasH,
450            m_pts.getWm(),
451            m_pts.getWc(),
452            meanFuncY,
453            residualFuncY,
454            squareRootDiscR);
455    var yHat = transRet.getFirst();
456    var Sy = transRet.getSecond();
457
458    // Compute cross covariance of the state and the measurements
459    Matrix<States, R> Pxy = new Matrix<>(m_states, rows);
460    for (int i = 0; i < m_pts.getNumSigmas(); i++) {
461      // Pxy += (sigmas_f[:, i] - x̂)(sigmas_h[:, i] - ŷ)ᵀ W_c[i]
462      var dx = residualFuncX.apply(m_sigmasF.extractColumnVector(i), m_xHat);
463      var dy = residualFuncY.apply(sigmasH.extractColumnVector(i), yHat).transpose();
464
465      Pxy = Pxy.plus(dx.times(dy).times(m_pts.getWc(i)));
466    }
467
468    // K = (P_{xy} / S_yᵀ) / S_y
469    // K = (S_y \ P_{xy}ᵀ)ᵀ / S_y
470    // K = (S_yᵀ \ (S_y \ P_{xy}ᵀ))ᵀ
471    Matrix<States, R> K =
472        Sy.transpose()
473            .solveFullPivHouseholderQr(Sy.solveFullPivHouseholderQr(Pxy.transpose()))
474            .transpose();
475
476    // x̂ₖ₊₁⁺ = x̂ₖ₊₁⁻ + K(y − ŷ)
477    m_xHat = addFuncX.apply(m_xHat, K.times(residualFuncY.apply(y, yHat)));
478
479    Matrix<States, R> U = K.times(Sy);
480    for (int i = 0; i < rows.getNum(); i++) {
481      m_S.rankUpdate(U.extractColumnVector(i), -1, false);
482    }
483  }
484}
